conclusion: Average velocity is the area under each v–t curve divided by the same total time t₁.
Car A’s curve and Car B’s curve are mirror images: where A’s speed is higher than v₁, B’s is lower by exactly the same amount, and vice-versa.
The two shaded areas under the curves are equal.
Equal areas ÷ equal time ⇒ equal average velocities.
Car A and Car B have the same average velocity during the interval 0 → t₁.
